page.title: 06Changing Patterns,Lenches
page.content: Life in the Lenches has changed considerably over the past decade or so. It is now necessary to have one's own transport to get out to the shops and leisure activities. Local children must go out of the area to school when they reach the age of ten.With the advent of more mechanisation on the land,work has to be found further afield. The previous agricultural and horticultural population has been more or less replaced by commmuters and people who have retired to the area. It is worthy of note that redundant farm buildings are being converted for housing. Old words and expressions have almost disappeared. One or two elderly inhabitants use words like 'wapper' -wasp and 'hud' -for husk of nut.
